articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Closing arguments conclude in Trump hush money trial, judge to deliver jury instructions Wednesday.
articles.title: Closing arguments conclude in Trump hush money trial, judge to deliver jury instructions Wednesday

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK, JENNIFER PELTZ, ERIC TUCKER and JILL COLVIN
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Donald Trump engaged in “a conspiracy and a cover-up,” a prosecutor told jurors during closing arguments Tuesday in the former president's hush money trial, while a defense lawyer branded the star witness as the “greatest liar of all time” and pressed the panel for an across-the-board acquittal.
articles.title: Trump prosecutor focuses on 'cover-up' in closing arguments while defense attacks key witness

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli shelling and airstrikes killed at least 37 people, most of them sheltering in tents, outside the southern Gaza city of Rafah overnight and on Tuesday — pummeling the same area where strikes triggered a deadly fire days earlier in a camp for displaced Palestinians — according to witnesses, emergency workers and hospital officials.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 37 Palestinians, most in tents, near Gaza's Rafah as offensive expands

articles.author: SEUNG MIN KIM and BRUCE SHIPKOWSKI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden will be formally nominated as the Democratic presidential nominee through a virtual roll call ahead of the party’s official convention in Chicago in August — a maneuver that will allow Biden to appear on the November ballot in Ohio.
articles.title: Democrats plan to nominate Biden by virtual roll call to meet Ohio ballot deadline

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD
articles.description: VATICAN CITY (AP) — Pope Francis apologized Tuesday after he was quoted using a vulgar and derogatory term about gay men to reaffirm the Catholic Church’s ban on gay priests.
articles.title: Pope apologizes after being quoted using vulgar term about gay men in talk about ban on gay priests

articles.author: ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The judge overseeing Donald Trump's classified documents case in Florida on Tuesday denied prosecutors' request to bar the former president from making public statements that could endanger law enforcement agents participating in the prosecution.
articles.title: Judge denies request to restrict Trump statements about law enforcement in classified records case

articles.author: DÁNICA COTO
articles.description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico (AP) — U.N. development specialist Garry Conille was named Haiti’s new prime minister Tuesday evening, nearly a month after a coalition within a fractured transitional council sought to choose someone else for the position.
articles.title: Transitional council in Haiti selects new prime minister for a country under siege by gangs

articles.author: LEKAN OYEKANMI and JOHN SEEWER
articles.description: HOUSTON (AP) — Strong storms with damaging winds and baseball-sized hail pummeled Texas on Tuesday, leaving one person dead and about 1 million businesses and homes without power as much of the U.S.
articles.title: Storms leave widespread outages across Texas, cleanup continues after deadly weekend across US

articles.author: AYANNA ALEXANDER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — During the presidential election four years ago, the Equal Ground Education Fund hired over 100 people to go door-to-door and attend festivals, college homecomings and other events to help register voters across Florida.
articles.title: Voter outreach groups targeted by new laws in several GOP-led states are struggling to do their work

articles.author: JOSEPH WILSON
articles.description: BARCELONA, Spain (AP) — Spain, Norway and Ireland formally recognized a Palestinian state on Tuesday in a coordinated effort by the three Western European nations to add international pressure on Israel to soften its response to last year’s Hamas-led attack.
articles.title: Spain, Norway and Ireland formally recognize a Palestinian state as EU rift with Israel widens
